title: Should You Investigate Extendicare Inc. (TSE:EXE) At CA$12.66?
description: TSX:EXE 1 Year Share Price vs Fair Value Explore Extendicare's Fair Values from the Community and select yours While...
content:
Explore Extendicare's Fair Values from the Community and select yours



While Extendicare Inc. (TSE:EXE) might not have the largest market cap around , it received a lot of attention from a substantial price movement on the TSX over the last few months, increasing to CA$14.73 at one point, and dropping to the lows of CA$12.27. Some share price movements can give investors a better opportunity to enter into the stock, and potentially buy at a lower price. A question to answer is whether Extendicare's current trading price of CA$12.66 reflective of the actual value of the small-cap? Or is it currently undervalued, providing us with the opportunity to buy? Let’s take a look at Extendicare’s outlook and value based on the most recent financial data to see if there are any catalysts for a price change.

This technology could replace computers: discover the 20 stocks are working to make quantum computing a reality.

Great news for investors – Extendicare is still trading at a fairly cheap price according to our price multiple model, where we compare the company's price-to-earnings ratio to the industry average. We’ve used the price-to-earnings ratio in this instance because there’s not enough visibility to forecast its cash flows. The stock’s ratio of 13.76x is currently well-below the industry average of 23.88x, meaning that it is trading at a cheaper price relative to its peers. However, given that Extendicare’s share is fairly volatile (i.e. its price movements are magnified relative to the rest of the market) this could mean the price can sink lower, giving us another chance to buy in the future. This is based on its high beta, which is a good indicator for share price volatility.

Check out our latest analysis for Extendicare

What does the future of Extendicare look like?

Investors looking for growth in their portfolio may want to consider the prospects of a company before buying its shares. Buying a great company with a robust outlook at a cheap price is always a good investment, so let’s also take a look at the company's future expectations. Extendicare's revenue growth are expected to be in the teens in the upcoming years, indicating a solid future ahead. Unless expenses grow at the same level, or higher, this top-line growth should lead to robust cash flows, feeding into a higher share value.

What This Means For You

Are you a shareholder? Since EXE is currently trading below the industry PE ratio, it may be a great time to increase your holdings in the stock. With an optimistic outlook on the horizon, it seems like this growth has not yet been fully factored into the share price. However, there are also other factors such as financial health to consider, which could explain the current price multiple.
summary: Extendicare Inc. (TSE:EXE) has seen significant price movement on the TSX over the past few months, with its market cap increasing to CA$14.73 at one point and dropping to CA $12.66. The company's current trading price is CA$12.65, which has seen some share price movements which can give investors a better opportunity to enter into the stock and potentially buy at a lower price. Despite this, Extendicare is still trading at a fairly cheap price according to our price multiple model, where we compare the company's price-to-earnings ratio to the industry average. However, given that the company’s high beta, which indicates share price volatility, this could give investors another opportunity to buy in the future. Future expectations for the company are expected to be high in the teens in the upcoming years, indicating a solid future ahead. Investors may also consider the potential for growth in their portfolio.
shortSummary: extendicare Inc. (TSE:EXE) is trading at CA$12.66, potentially undervalued, with potential for future price changes due to volatile share prices and uncertain financial prospects.

About the Company
| Founded | Employees | CEO | Website |
|---|---|---|---|
| 1968 | n/a | Michael Guerriere | www.extendicare.com |
Extendicare Inc., through its subsidiaries, provides care and services for seniors in Canada. The company offers long term care services; and home health care services, such as nursing care, occupational, physical and speech therapy, and assistance with daily activities, as well as management, consulting, and other services to third parties. It operates through the Extendicare, ParaMed, Extendicare Assist, and SGP Purchasing Partner Network brands.

argos_summary: Extendicare Inc. (TSE:EXE) has experienced significant price fluctuations, currently trading at CA$12.66, which is below the industry average price-to-earnings ratio of 23.88, suggesting it may be undervalued. The company is expected to see revenue growth in the teens over the coming years, indicating a positive outlook for future performance. Investors may find this an opportune time to increase their holdings, although the stock's volatility poses risks.
